name: UpdateOrCreateGithubFile
description:
Create or update a file in a GitHub repository.

This tool creates a new file or updates an existing one in a GitHub repository. It requires authentication with an access token having the `workflow` scope. Avoid using this tool concurrently with file deletion to prevent conflicts.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the GitHub repository, not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: file_path_in_repository
parameters.description: The file path within the repository where the file will be created or updated.

parameters.name: file_update_details
parameters.description: JSON object containing author, committer, content, message, branch, and sha details for file creation or update. Base64 encode file content.

email.description: The email of the author or committer of the commit. You'll receive a `422` status code if `email` is omitted.

name.description: The name of the author or committer of the commit. You'll receive a `422` status code if `name` is omitted.

author.description: The author of the file. Default: The `committer` or the authenticated user if you omit `committer`.

branch.description: The branch name. Default: the repository’s default branch (usually `master`)

email.description: The email of the author or committer of the commit. You'll receive a `422` status code if `email` is omitted.

name.description: The name of the author or committer of the commit. You'll receive a `422` status code if `name` is omitted.

committer.description: The person that committed the file. Default: the authenticated user.

content.description: The new file content, using Base64 encoding.

sha.description: **Required if you are updating a file**. The blob SHA of the file being replaced.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

email.description: The email of the author or committer of the commit. You'll receive a `422` status code if `email` is omitted.

name.description: The name of the author or committer of the commit. You'll receive a `422` status code if `name` is omitted.

author.description: The author of the file. Default: The `committer` or the authenticated user if you omit `committer`.

branch.description: The branch name. Default: the repository’s default branch (usually `master`)

email.description: The email of the author or committer of the commit. You'll receive a `422` status code if `email` is omitted.

name.description: The name of the author or committer of the commit. You'll receive a `422` status code if `name` is omitted.

committer.description: The person that committed the file. Default: the authenticated user.

content.description: The new file content, using Base64 encoding.

sha.description: **Required if you are updating a file**. The blob SHA of the file being replaced.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
